results.title: Ronin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Frank Mancuso, FGM Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Told proficiently, “Ronin” is an action/thriller about a group of renegade criminals for hire, a gang of international professional thieves and killers, without allegiances to country or cause. Deirdre, a mysterious Irish woman, organises a crack team for one high-risk job - to steal a valuable case of unknown contents. The team consists of an ex-CIA officer, a former European intelligence officer, a skilled driver, a top electronics expert and a weapons specialist. The five don’t know, like or particularly trust one another but must work together to get the job done. Director Frankenheimer, somewhat of an expert in the field of car chase sequences, flexes his knowledge here with spectacular rides through the narrow streets of Paris and Cannes. Pyrotechnics, rolling cars, shootouts and a minor love interest make “Ronin” a fairly standard crime movie with some very impressive stunts. International cast includes: Robert De Niro, Natascha McElhone, Stellan Skarsgard, Jonathon Pryce and Jean Reno. Script is by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, Hannibal, State and Main) working under the pseudonym Richard Weisz.

results.title: Ronald Reagan
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
From small town boy to President of the United States, Ronald Reagan never forgot the teachings of his mother’s Christian Church and its vision of America as God’s chosen country. He took the world to the brink of nuclear war, and then came close to abolishing the entire nuclear arsenal of the United States and the Soviet Union. Features rare and exclusive footage. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Ron the zookeeper
results.brief_description:
Claymation story about Sushi, the last male grey panda and his reluctance to be a sperm donator to save his species from extinction.
WARNING: Contains sex scenes, coarse language and adult themes

results.title: Ron Shelley: civil engineer
results.brief_description: Typical experiences of a design engineer working on road and bridge construction in Papua-New Guinea, illustrating the development role of better communications. Discusses living conditions in Port Moresby. Ron Selley works for the Department of Public Works as a Design Engineer, has designed seventy bridges, and travels to remote areas of the Territory for his work.

results.title: Ron Magliozzi and Jenny He interview: 'Tim Burton: The Exhibition'
results.brief_description: Jenny He (Curatorial Assistant, Department of Film) and Ron Magliozzi (Assistant Curator, Department of Film) are co-organizers of the Tim Burton exhibition, from MoMa (The Museum of Modern Art) in New York. Here they are interviewed by Kate Warren, ACMI’s Assistant Curator, about their work on ‘Tim Burton: The Exhibition’. They take us through the process, from inception, through to collaborating with Tim Burton, of Burton’s work and the curatorial process. As well as viewing Tim Burton’s work from an artistic perspective, we also gain insight into the art of the curator and curatorial perspective.

results.title: Ron Barassi's top 31 players
results.brief_description: Football legend Ron Barassi selects his top 31 players from the past 31 years of Australian Rules Football. His selections (in random order) are: Michael Tuck, Leigh Matthews, Robert Flower, Gerard Healy, John Nicholls, Ted Whitten, Kevin Bartlett, Paul Roos, Doug Wade, Simon Madden, Peter Daicos, Malcolm Blight, Roger Hart, John Rantall, Keith Greig, Francis Bourke, Tony Lockett, Stephen Kernahan, Geoff Southby, Ian Stewart, Darrel Baldeck, Alex Jesaulenko, Bob Skilton, Gary Ablett, Greg Williams, Wayne Schimmelbusch, Kevin Murray, Barry Cable, Bruce Doull, Graham Farmer, Peter Hudson. Features fantastic footage of some of the legends of the game performing at the height of their careers.

results.title: Ron and Mandi Heath: weavers
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
This film looks at the life style of Ron Heath, once a geologist and Mandi Heath who was a teacher, and their total commitment to their craft of weaving. They hope to make the farm on which they live self-sufficient and are continually experimenting with methods of weaving in their workshop which is in the nearby town.

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.
